item.title: 2024 wrap up
item.description:
1. Something new

  • Adopt a cat

    • Adopting Morty has been one of the most important things for me this year, even though it only began in October. It reflects a profound shift within me‚Äîan acceptance of responsibility, even if it‚Äôs for a cat.
    • I know myself well, and I‚Äôve always tended to avoid responsibility whenever possible. While I‚Äôve lived with cats before, this is the first time I‚Äôve truly felt the weight of being solely responsible for a living being. Providing Morty with a stable life‚Äîensuring his food, environment, and companionship‚Äîis now my duty, and I‚Äôve embraced this reality. I even feel guilty if I go out too often in a week, which used to be natural for me. üôÉ

  • Buy a house

    • After returning from Malta, I began house viewings and got sale agreed within two weeks‚Äîremarkably quick. Navigating the mortgage and insurance process went smoothly, but moving in May was overwhelming. Managing utilities, internet, furniture purchases and assembly, packing, and unpacking felt like an endless task.
    • I‚Äôm still unsure if this marks a significant milestone for me. The decision was driven by financial considerations, yet I feel no emotional attachment to owning a home. My lifestyle remains unchanged‚ÄîI still live with housemates, socialize with friends, and occasionally date. It hasn‚Äôt impacted my cash flow or consumption habits.
    • However, many view homeownership as a hallmark of adulthood‚Äîso perhaps it is.

  • Climbing, scuba diving, swimming, dancing

    • Last year, I wasn‚Äôt obsessed with anything in particular‚Äîjust exploring outside my comfort zone. Having spent years doing lower-body-intensive sports like running, cycling, and hiking, I decided to focus on water sports this year. That‚Äôs why I took up swimming and scuba diving. While I‚Äôm far from an expert, the goal was to feel more at ease in water and to unlock the experience of exploring an underwater world.
    • I also try dancing for a similar reason, as it‚Äôs a way to express emotions physically rather than through words or thoughts. I tried salsa and swing, finding swing suit me better‚Äîthough it clearly requires more practice.
    • Climbing has been a bigger focus, heavily influenced by friends like West, Alexis, Valerie, and Josh. I love outdoor rope climbing, as it immerses me in nature in a unique way. Feeling the texture of the rocks and being grounded in the moment has become deeply fulfilling. It’s also a interesting way for travel and make friends.

  • Experience, Connection, Love

    • This year has been filled with memorable trips that deepened my bonds with friends. In Spain, Qingyue and I grew close for the first time after three years of knowing each other. In the UK, I shared in Ruoxi’s milestone moment at her PhD graduation. In the USA, I reconnected with Michael, reliving memories from our graduation eight years ago and making new memories.
    • These journeys stirred profound emotions, prompting me to write heartfelt reflections on Instagram after each trip, expressing gratitude for the people and moments shared. I even updated my status to include ‚ÄúExperience, Connection, Love‚Äù alongside ‚ÄúCosmopolitanism, localism, culture, and history.‚Äù
    • In my younger years, I focused on achievement‚Äînot for recognition, but to push myself forward. Recent years, however, I start to value deep, meaningful connections with people.
    • At my funeral, I hope people remember not just the remarkable things I achieved but the joy and laughter I brought into their lives.
    • Get more feedback about I’m supportive and how I influence them in a good way üò¨

  • Get less avoidant and become more safe

    • Thank God, I no longer attract anxious types, nor am I drawn to broken people anymore.
    • From April to July, I had 12 sessions with the therapist I saw two years ago. Initially, it was to address being triggered by a dating experience, but our discussions soon delved into childhood trauma. I came to realize how challenging life was from ages 8 to nearly 25, with lingering scars still present. Confronting these wounds, reminding myself ‚ÄúI am different now, my life has changed, I can choose new behaviors, and I am safe,‚Äù was incredibly hard.
    • I‚Äôm deeply grateful for undertaking this inner work, even though it‚Äôs been difficult. In return, I become more sensitive to people’s emotions as well as mine. “Pay money to therapist and learn how to be angry at my friends” ü§£

2. Something old

  • keep traveling:

    • January: Hungary - Budapest, Slovakia - Bratislava, Malta (9 days)
    • March: Netherlands - Amsterdam, Leiden
    • May: Spain - Santander, Mallorca (10 days) w/ Qingyue
    • June: Galway (2 days) w/ Kenzie
    • July: UK - London, Cambridge (6 days) w/ Ruoxi
    • September: Greece - Athens, Geogeria, Armenia (14 days) w/ Damon, Hanyang, Matthew, Diane
    • November: USA - New York, Chicago (9 days) w/ Michael, West, Alexis
    • December: Egypt - Alexsanderia, Cairo, Dahab (17 days)

  • physical health

    • This year i’ve exercised for 213 days compared to 207 last year. feel good about the data.
    • It’s surprised to compare data and see how much i get stronger. The end of last year, i could only do 2 pull-up, in 2024, once i could do 10 pull-up in a row (now drop to 6). And push-up is easy 20 compare to 15. I don’t pay much attention to calisthenics because i’m more interested in performance on climbing.
    • I’m satified on my current state related to strength, cardio and flexibility…
    • next year: improve performance on climbing, target is 6A, and more water sports.

  • dinner party: 3rd year

    • host 9 dinner party the whole year
    • This year the permanent seat belongs to Hanyang, Yangyang and Damon. Matthew moved to Berlin after March, Damon will move to London next year. Have more once-a-while guests. And because the dinning table in my house becomes smaller, the crew becomes smaller too.
    • Hanyang hosts lots of memorable dinner party, I gave her “host of the year"ü´°
    • Need to think make more close friends in Dublin üòÇ

3. Something borrowed

Reflecting on 2024, I‚Äôm surprised that how I‚Äôve almost forgotten the challenges I faced at the start of the year. I feel quite lost in early spring after three years of full-time work. A dating experience triggered me and led me back to therapy, while the stress of moving to a new home weighed heavily on me. I even found myself angry at close friends for not helping ‚Äî then realize I hadn‚Äôt asked for their support.

My therapist once said, ‚ÄúHow people emerge from difficulties isn‚Äôt shaped solely by their experiences, but by the support they receive during those times.‚Äù Perhaps that‚Äôs why these struggles haven‚Äôt left scars‚Äîbecause my friends stood by me, turning pain into fleeting moments rather than lasting wounds.

4. Something blue

nothing worth writing here XD

5. a silver sixpence

  • In summary, this year has felt calm‚Äîcontinuing along familiar paths with no extreme highs or unexpected lows. Perhaps learning to embrace a steady, uneventful year is part of the rhythm of middle-aged life. üòä

  • I hope this year I could follow my plans to achieve retire early and this requires some time and efforts, let’s see ü§ûüèª

  • Wishes are the same as last year, hope to live

a psychologically rich life with ‚Äúinteresting experiences in which novelty and/or complexity are accompanied by profound changes in perspective.‚Äù

  • Happy and Healthy, me and my loved ones.

item.title: 2023 wrap up
item.description:
1. Something new

  • First year cyling!

    • cycling is definitely the most important hobby for me this year. From strava, it shows i cycled 2500km. If taking commute into consideration, would be around 3000km.
    • Join Clontarf Cycling Club. ngl, the club is super Irish and middle-aged people over 40, 50, 60 and i’m a outlier. However, learned a lot from them and every time group spin, it’s a challenge and fun to push myself.
    • Cycling not only gives me the way to exercise, but also brings me to lots of places around Dublin i’ve never been. Before I never go out of Dublin city center. But this year, i’ve been to Bray, Dalkey, Wicklow, Enniskerry, Killakee, Glencullen in the south, Portmarnock, Malahide, Swords, Skerries in the north, Lucan in the south. (Sorry, this is all the village names around Dublin suburbs.) And the group always guided me to lovely cute local coffee shop. This is the most authentic Irish experience for me as an immigrants üòÇ

    First 100km in Feb

    Wicklow spin in May, Sally gap - Wicklow gap, i look so young with the group XD

  • Bike Touring

    • Another thing cycling brings me is bike touring. As traveling after so many years, i know my preference is to go to local places (don’t need to be famous) and see how local people’s daily lifes and behaviors. However, because i can’t drive, i’m limited to the places I could reach by public transportation. This year, because of bike touring, I’ve seen lots of interesting but niche places, as well as enjoying cycling at the same time.
    • There are lots of memorable spins and a bit risky “adventure” because of bike touring, such as cycle on southern freeway (Autopista Sur), carrying bike while hiking in Tenerife…
    • The most memorable one is in Naples, I rented a bike for 3 days there. Here’s the travel notes taken back then.

    In the beginning, I only stayed in the central area of Naples and had a biased impression of this multi-layered city. The closely-built, narrow alleys reminded me of the urban villages in Guangzhou. But if you go to the west coast and climb up the hill, the vibe of the neighborhood is similar to Mid-Levels in Hong Kong. It’s also similar to Lisbon and Istanbul in some ways. As it turns out, there must be some common patterns to developing cities.

    Cycled to Pompeii, around Mount Vesuvius, and experienced the stone road, which made my hands and butt vibrate all the way and met traffic jam in literally every single town!

    People in napoli are very confident drivers, both cars and motors. They turn without signal lights, pass aside you within 0.5m. In the crossings, most of time no traffic lights, people need to negotiate with hands, facial expressions, beeps.

    People parked anywhere, anytime. Parked 2 Columns on the same side of roads. Parked in the crossings. Parked suddenly to speak to passengers.

    As I didn‚Äôt see any accident, I would say it‚Äôs a super good self-organized society üëç

    Took a ferry with my bike to Ischia and had a thermal spring bath at Baia di Sorgeto, where had to manually mix the cold sea water with hot spring water.

    First Bike Touring in Malaga, firt time with Clip Shoes and Fall, February

    Biggest Climb this year in Tenerife, March!

    Naples in April, on the west coast looking to Vesuvius

    Dusseldorf along Rhine River in June, cycle with Diane

    Erhai Greenway, Dali in October

  • Get promotion

    • I don’t talk much about work because i’m not ambitious on career. But still, this year i’ve made so much progress as a software engineer. Looking back, i almost didn’t do any solid work in the first one year and half. For example, i haven’t made any commits in my team’s core packages, either C or Rust. But since April, I picked a very technical challenging project in Rust. So I had a steep learning curve on Rust, then our core package… Then I picked another bigger both technical and design difficult project both in Go and Rust, also need to lead 2 new graduate teammates… In the end, I finished them all, from knowing nothing to deliver results as well as own a big project. Then I got promoted…

  • The way of learning

    • I often find myself starting things just as I cross the bottem passing grade, which makes the process somewhat painful, but leads to significant progress. Last year, I didn’t even complete a two-day hiking trail, when i start to hike in Dolomites over 170+ kilometers‚Ä¶ This year, after just 2 months of owning a road bike, I joined a cycling club with the shortest group spin is over 70km. When I first got into DJing last year, I immediately started making friends in the DJ community. I’ve never felt uncomfortable that I might be less skilled compared to someone else; instead, I’m always amazed by their talents and skills. I openly share what I’m into with almost everyone, which leads to more chances of serendipitously meeting like-minded people and engaging with them.

  • Go back to China

    • After 3 years, I’m back in China. Actually i don’t feel strange. I still have lots of friends who could hangout together and have surprisling(…) strong connection and mutal understanding. My fav pub in town still open, fav restaurant still open. Stay probably 3 weeks at home, had some family time with mom, Tiantian and Kangkang. And stay over with so many friend’s house. Thx for hosting me.

  • Travel and stay with friends

    • I had a reserved attitute about traveling with friends, the reasons are complicated and mixed. Partly because i don’t feel comfortable to stay with people together, partly because i don’t believe I could still keep having fun with one person. Partly because i like having adventure alone. Traveling solo will give me a adventurous feeling. But with my comfort zone with people progressing, I’ve arranged several trips with friends this year (sometimes one person, sometimes two.) Most of time, it goes well. Even something annoyed happened, I will communicate about it in the end. I do detect i don’t have fight or run situation for long time.

  • Random stuff

    • get stamp 4 (a work permit in Ireland, which don’t need company’s sponsorship)
    • didn’t make lots of new friends this year, still meet new people, sometimes during traveling, sometimes in Dublin, but not close and don’t have time to hangout. maybe i’m already very comfortable with current friend circle but anyways, why all the friends should be close friends?

2. Something old

  • keep traveling: 78 days

    • January: Portugal - Faro (2 days)
    • February & March: Spain - Malaga, Granada, Tenerife (10 days)
    • March & April: Italy - Rome, Neplas (11 days) w/ John, Frances, Wayne
    • June: Germany - Koln, Dusseldorf (3 days) w/ Diane; Spain - Barcelona (5 days) w/ Matthew
    • July: Swizterland & France - Geneva, Chamonix, Zermatt, Zurich (15 days) w/ Wayne, John, Frances, West, Alex
    • September & October: Hong Kong (2 days); China - Chaozhou, Shanghai, Suzhou, Linhai (12 days); Korean - Jeju (5 days) w/ Josh, Ying
    • October: China - Dali (5 days) w/ Donglai & Iris; Hong Kong (1 day)

    The focus regions for me this year is South Europe, especailly Spain and Italy. Quote my instagram post

In the last 3-4 months, I visited the following cities in South Europe around the Mediterranean Sea: Portugal’s Lisbon and Faro, Spain’s Malaga, Granada and Barcelona, and Italy’s Rome, Naples. If looking back a bit further, also visited Turkey’s Istanbul, Izmir, Fethiye and Antalya. Could say had a rough impression of the north Mediterranean area.

Born and raised in a region with a long, stable cultural history (Zhejiang is one of China’s core cultural regions since the Song Dynasty), I feel fascinated and amazed by how many culturally diverse influences have shaped the Mediterranean, including Carthage, Rome, the Byzantine Empire, the Ottoman Empire, Arabic, and Moors.

All the cities I’ve visited have historical sites left by the Romans, Arabs, Carthaginians and Ottoman Turks. Over a long period, these empires' borders have experienced expansion and contraction. What were once mosques have become churches in Granada, and what were once churches have become mosques in Istanbul. The alternation of civilizations happens all the time, and each time, the victors try to tell a historical narrative to prove their legitimacy while the fusion of cultures still exists in daily life and some physical objects.

The mental map in the brain often differs from the real physical world. As an Asian/Chinese, I could name almost all of Chinese provinces, their capitals, main terrains, as well as “big cities” in Western Europe, and lots of places in North America. At the same time, I was surprised to find out that the Strait of Gibraltar between Spain and Morocco is less than 15 kilometers wide, Sicily is much closer to Tunis than Milan, and Alexandria, Egypt, was one of the most famous Greek cities in history, with a massive Greek community until Nasser took power.

Globalization, or cross-region and cross-continent communication, isn’t a new thing. Iconic buildings and landmarks become modern idolatry, and the world has more rough grainness before filters, which requires observation with closer distance and immersion.

  • physical health

    • This year i’ve exercised for 200~ days compared to 190~ last year.
    • my workout pattern become a bit different than before
      • during workday, try to work on abs/back/chest for 3 times, and in summer, will go to cycling during sunset time with good weather for 12-20km.
      • on weekends, have a loose rotation between cycling with group (70-90km), climbing with random friends, and swimming with Chenglin. oh yeah, almost missed that, this year i went swimming around 10 times and learned freestyle with help of Chenglin.
      • do 1 hour yoga for weekends and 10 mins stretch everyday in the morning since November.
      • my upper strength increases a lot this year, the pull-up bar are so useful and effective, at first, i need to pull up with 45kg resistance band, now i could do 2 pull-up (not good form but sill üò¨). The push-up increases from 7 dirty form to 15 clean form standard form.
    • not hiking a lot, but becuase go for Haute Route in Switzerland this year, so still hike 267.7km in total
    • next year: improve freestyle swimming, also i’m interested in Calisthenics, didn’t see the possibility that i could do flag or planche next year hahaha but will see how much i could improve as standards in Convict Conditioning. Now, I’m in chest5, leg10, back5 and abs10. Next year hope to improve chest and back to 10, also work on spine and shoulder.

  • dinner party: 2rd year

    • host 12 dinner party this year in total (not including last time)
    • Second year, don’t feel any pressure, also less excited haha, now i feel this is more like a traditional ritual for my friend circle. This year, the close circle has some changes, first, Diane moves to Paris last October, and then Hanyang moved out to Donaghmede in the far north. Obviously, we hang out less frequently than before. Both Matthew and I traveled too much to be both in Dublin (?) But more close to Yangyang. Children will always grow up and leave home. üòÇ I need to accept this.
    • Will still have Jarry’s living room next year.

3. Something borrowed

Looking back the whole year, I realized the happeniss of this year is from friends (either friends in Dublin or friends around the world), my family, travel, music, movie and cycling. I feel so grateful and lucky that I could have so many wonderful friends hanging out with me, taking care of me, give me support; I have a healthy body and some money to do the hobbies I like, the adventure I choose; all the people who create the amaizng films, albums, live music and books (still alive or in the history).

So next year, I will keep all this in mind, treasure my friends and family, pay and “fight” for what I love by both actions and price.

4. Something blue

In 2020’s summary, I wrote “In the past few years, a persistent issue for me has been the frequent feeling of strangeness towards my past self and a sense of detachment from my past life.” The strangeness is not only from the environment, the friend circle, but also my behavior pattern and mindset. It sounds weird, but this year is the first time that I truly accept the current me is real me. And I will keep it’s this stage of me and probably will change in the future. Why I feel it’s something blue, in many novels, the main character goes through challenges and hardships, returning to their hometown having achieved some success, even becoming somewhat better in some ways. Along the way, they gain friends. Yet, despite the struggles being a story that can be shared with others, you still feel a sense of sadness, a sadness that might not even be rooted in loss.

I cried when I got onboarded on the flight back to China.

Quote notes back then

Last weeks in Dublin, before heading back to Asia after 3 yrs. When reflecting on the past three years, the cliche summary is, “I’ve become a better version of myself.”

There’s often a tendency that we want to accumulate our possessions, the titles we hold, and indulge in fancy travels and experiences to show people our identity. But what if you were suddenly stripped of all that, thrown into a completely unfamiliar world where no one understands the labels from your previous life? Would you still recognize who you truly are? I keep questioning myself.

At the age of 29, I hope to keep living a simpler life with few things and not depending on lots of needs, yet savor all the love and support from my loved ones.

Another thing probably should not categorize as blue. At the beginning of this year, I know M.D. got married by accident. It still arouses mixed feelings, which combine with “Oh he got married” and “I feel happy for him because he must be love her, otherwise he won’t choose to be married.” He is the most important person who influences me in so many ways in my 20s, and I don’t think there will be another person who have similar impact on me. But I will have still my 30s, 40s and etc on my own good way.

5. a silver sixpence

a psychologically rich life is one with ‚Äúinteresting experiences in which novelty and/or complexity are accompanied by profound changes in perspective.‚Äù

item.title: 2022 wrap up
item.description:
• ps: will have a separate post about books, music and movies.

1. Something new

  • first long multi-day (11 days) hiking with 10kg+ backpack in Italy, Dolomites.

    • details and photos on instagram, best travel experience this year and makes me want to do multi-day hiking every year.

  • learn “feel it before thinking”

    • this is one of the biggest change in recent years. As person who loves and trusts logic and knowledge, when i was young, logic is more important and higer than body/feeling and have strong preference about words, all the things which could express in a logical way (which means you could reason and summarize patterns).
    • For example, if i’m interested in running, i will buy several books about running and read it first. If i’m interested in some hiking trails, i will read articles and books about the history behind it first. There is nothing wrong, but a very limited perspective. Hiking and into natures teaches me how to let my body feel it rather than thinking about the history and society first. (Do I really care about the civilization history of Lycian way? A bit, but not that much. I just want to be between moutains and oceans.)

  • learn how to ask for help and communicte effectively

    • As written in Being Connected, I asked help from professional therapist. When i feel down in April, I tell my friends that i need their emotional support and company. When I want to hang out with friends but don’t have energy to prepare something, I will directly say to Damon “Could we hang out at your place and you prepare the food, i could bring some meals and drinks?” hahaüòÇ

  • learn how to construct my life without moving to new city.

    • After 15 yrs old, the longest time i’ve lived in one city is 4 yrs for university, then keeping moving cities every year or every two year. because of citizenship requirement of staying in dublin for 5 yrs, i have the worries and uncomfort. Moving will definitely give you new experience and excitement. After around half a year in Dublin, I feel bored and have the impulse to leave. Then i start to learn how to contrust my life and experience new things without moving.
    1. experience new activities with old friends and tell myself old and familar friends are important even though they are not as interesting as new friends sometimes üòÇ
    2. learn new interests and make friends based on that. Last year, it’s more about electronic music.
    3. travel abroad every month to get freshed. I could say I had a quite amazing year based in Dublin and don’t afriad to live here for 4 more years with new ways of learning and improving in other ways.

  • emotional health and relationship

    • details in Being Connected, spend so much time and energy on this project in the last 2 yrs… (friend: please don’t treat it as a project)

  • dinner party

    • start to learn cooking after moving to Dublin and hosted first dinner party with Josh, Diane, Damon in last December.
    • after cooking for a while, it’s a bit easy to cook single meal, then designing a menu, time management of cooking more than 6 meals, sharing food with friends interests me.
    • this year hosted 14 times, guests grow from 3 to 8 people and the nubmer never goes down. üòÇ because some become permanent residents and there are always new friends to join us.
    • so much fun and memory from this series, hope could keep doing it next year.

  • electronic music

    • didn’t listen to lots of eletronic music before and never been to gig, the first one is March this year and bought a mixer in June, make some new friends and been to around 20 gigs, the most intense period is once a week… now is once a month
    • play music for people twice and uploaded a mix https://soundcloud.com/jarrywan9/be-water
    • didn’t played it for months but such an interesting genre, had fun, maybe will pick up again some day (hope so)

  • giving

    • the best review from Hanyang and Diane “Thx Jarry for adopting me in Dublin”. realized now i could give people lots of good stuff, sometimes as a good friend, sometimes as a random person with information people need.
    • when getting older, start to meet younger generation… still not clear about this part, but definitly start to give more than before.

  • some random stuff

    1. start to use makeup, nail polish and wear dresses more frequently. become used to feel comfortable to dress like a female… it could be a long paragraph about how to accept my gender but i’m lazy…
    2. know what’s great x feel like. terrific x doesn‚Äôt mean everything, okay x doesn‚Äôt worth efforts, next one is always better XD
    3. start to do orthodontics since July

2. Something old

  • keep traveling: 60 days

    • April: Turkey - Izmir, Dalaman, Antalya, Gaziantep, Sanliurfa, Diyarbakir, Mardin, Midyat (14 days)
    • July: UK - London (4 days)
    • August: UK - London, Portmouth (3 days); Spain - Barcelona (6 days)
    • September: Italy - Milan, Venice, Bressanone, Feltre, Dolomites Alta Via 2 (16 days)
    • October: Spain - Madrid (3 days)
    • November: UK - Cambridge, Manchester, Lake District (4 days)
    • December: Portugal - Lisbon (6 days), Faro (2 days); France - Paris (4 days)

  • don’t have any goals about traveling because it just takes time. it’s a habit not a goal. but still have some plans and find something new this year

    1. realized i need to stay for a city/ region for at least 4+ days, otherwise didn’t get the sense of being there, or just being there physically. that’s my feelings about Milan & Madrid trip.
    2. lots of travel time is spent with friends, especially city trips, have unforgettable memories with old friends, will keep doing that
    3. start to make friends during traveling. in the last 10 yrs of traveling, it’s very rare for me to make friends, exchange contact numbers, keep touch after separating. even though staying in hostel, just stay away from people. this year, i make several friends which we could meet again if we have chance in the same city, or at least exchange social media to keep updated. i think the reason is that i could make connections with people now even though it’s weak connection.

  • physical health

    • This year i’ve exercised for 190~ days compared to 175~ last year.
    • have really good sleep quality, almost no dreams
    • don’t have big difference about the frequency, but still have some changes
      1. start to do more weight exercise and target to specific muscles. because i did more workout like yoga, running, hiking etc before, i have very strong leg muscles while the upper body is quite weak. start to use resistence bands, go bloudering to exercise muscles of butt, back and chest. not very impressive progress, but will keep doing this year.
      2. hiking a lot. i start to do hiking in 2018 living in Chengdu, Sichuan Province. and i didn’t hike that much. in 2020, hiked 17 times with around 204 km. in 2021, hiked 10 times with 81 km, 3529m. this year, hiked 21 times with 315 km, 15997m.
      3. already know next year will do lots of cycling, hope won’t have any accidents ü§ûüèº
    • thx for having a good health to do so many things in 1 yr üòÇ

  • friends

    • after leaving china for around 3 yrs, currently, my friend circle is like that
      • close friends in Dublin, normally hang out every 2 weeks
      • close friends not in Dublin which still talk every 2-3 months
      • old friends which don’t talk but could meet if we are in the same city
      • new friends in Dublin, hang out if there are some activites
      • new acquaintances around the world…
    • i have similar opinons abuot friendship and romantic relationship, at least people need to respect mutally, could have good time together, try to understand and support each other.
    • no matter how long we separated, you could still feel understood, seen and supported by some friends. will finally meet some friends in China in 2023!

  • some random stuff

    1. still organize an event to let some presenters sharing experience and information about migrating and working in ireland
    2. spend some time on consultion of cv, mock interviews etc

3. Something borrowed

  • thx a million to my dear younger brother - Tiantian. one night in December, he texted me he and dad were in hospital emergency room because dad felt uncomfortable about this heart and turns out he has blood vessel blockage. Tiantian signed the documents for operations while my mom was in another city.

4. Something blue

  • can’t remember anything could put in this part. only break my heart in April but already moved on the whole things.
  • it doesn’t mean there is nothing difficult happened the whole year, but my mental resilience has been improved, also with safety net based on friends' emotional support, healthy physical body and stable life state. so didn’t fall into any mental breakdown and emotional abyss.
  • in general, have a good mental health this year and smiled a lot. Donglai said “Your face don’t have the misery of East Asians now” one night, walking back from a dance party or dinner at friends', met one passenger on the street, asked me “why you’re so happy"üòÇ

5. a silver sixpence

  • last year, in this seesion, i wish i could hang out with people less and give more time to myself. from records, last year there are 130+ days hanging out with people compared to 180+ days this year.

    • There are several reasons 1. i’ve traveled for 60 days these years compared to 10 days last year. 2. i start to do sports with friends and dance with friends, I do hang out with people a lot but it also contributes to my interest about hiking, bloudering and eletronic music.

  • my ideal state now is: people will feel relaxed and happy with me (realized could make people feel relaxed is a rare and precious character), and my complexity and depth based on the experience, knowledge and mindset. just chill is so boring. think i already achieve this state in some degrees : )

    • quote from this article:

      a psychologically rich life is one with ‚Äúinteresting experiences in which novelty and/or complexity are accompanied by profound changes in perspective.‚Äù”

  • when i was early 20s, i’m afriad of being 30s because seeing lots of 30s people trapped in their boring life and keep unchanged for so many years. I’m so close to 30s now, i don’t fear it at all. The age doesn’t limit myself to make changes and have new improvements and adventure. i’m so proud of myself about this year and see u next year : )

item.title: Being Connected
item.description:
This post is written in English because I feel more comfortable to talk about feelings in English than Chinese.

I never thought I would post a blog about this topic. But people change : )

1

There is a TV show called Bojack Horseman, people will find they feel related to the characters. I feel related to Bojack most, because I’ve hurt people when I was an teenager and early 20s. I would apologize and thought I have already apologized, people should forgive me, but it’s their rights to not forgive. I blame myself because of this pattern for many years.

I also know this behavior pattern is learned from my father, I spend many years to break this cycle. I said to myself, I should never hurt people’s feelings on purpose and never say hurtful words to people. When I was young, I feel pround of being mean, quote myself “Being mean is a kind of wit.” I have confidence that I’m not like my father for at least 3-4 yrs, and I’m not like my mother, either. I’m totally different from them. Living with parents and younger brothers for 2 years before moving in Ireland, although upset sometimes, I improved the communication and relationship among the family members and hardly lost my temper.

I made lots of efforts to control my emotions. If recall back, maybe 4-5 years ago, I objectize myself. I don’t think myself is important, just a small part of objective world. I’m obessed into society, culture, history, architecture, everything outside of me and has nothing related to myself or people. The rare time I feel connected is when I was in the nature, as a small part of universe. I lived thousands of kilometers far away from family and friends and didn’t looking for connections. I just visited friends in Shanghai or other cities once or twice every year, family too.

Time flies. To be honest, I don’t know how this happens. But once when I was in Shanghai in 2020, I’m talking with DongLai, said I’m bothered that every time I visit Shanghai, I have lots of friends to meet, I made the busy schedule, every friend have one meal time, and I feel exhausted. One 10-year friend asked me “Why you can’t spend more time with me?” I don’t know the answer when she asked but then realized because I don’t want to admit some peopel are more special for me even if they are. Donglai invited me to stay over at her house and I said okay, then cancelled the plan tomorrow with someone not so close to me. That’s an important moment/decision for me, I know it sounds weird.üòÇ

2

The friendship is so difficult, not to mention romantic relationship. I didn’t have any dates during 2014 - 2020. After arriving in Ireland, I start to try. It’s an interesting experience when you didn’t have any physical or mental intimacy with anyone for a long time. After several dates, I found I finishes with people after 1-2 months because of small reasons even I feel well in the beginning. I asked one friend, how he decides to continue to date with someone or not. He said “Just follow your emotions.” I said “The problem is I don’t have emotions…” Another reason why I finish early maybe is I’m afraid people will leave me sooner or later, so I leave them first.

I can’t figure out how to make my emotions back, but I decide to break the pattern of finishing early. After moving in Dublin last autumn, I met S. He is a really nice guy. He treats me really well and I thought I also did well, I will plan the dates, cook dinner, give gifts. When he said “I feel you’re not interested in me, you talked about our common interests but don’t care how’s my day”, I was surprised because things are smooth from my side. (My therapist said because i didn’t learn to care “how’s your day” during my life). Donglai and OY agrees it must be my fault, my emotional involement is obviously not enough. In the same time, I read the attachment theory and conclude I’m a avodiant type.

Then I met D. This time, I really try to invole emotionally and behave like a secure attachment style. But the situation is more complicated. First, he’s great and nice to me, but he doesn’t want closeness at this period. He’s working on setting boundaries with people. And I’m working on being close to people, basically, we are on the opposite direction. Second, because I really like him and involve emotionally, I start to feel unsecure and anxious. I read several books, but it doesn’t help much. In the end, he decides to finish and I also know it’s the right decision.

The good side of this experience is 1. I start to involve emotionally and my emotion is back. 2. I still could have strong feelings for people after 8 yrs lack of passion. 3. I learned a lot from him about being honest of my feelings.

The reflection is 1. I will feel unsecure if I’m close to person, and obviously my self-regulation is not good as I assume. 2. Even though you like someone, it’s not good relationship if it starts to have negative influence. Pay attention to which kind of yourself he brings out.

It’s the time I should ask for help, which is also my last year’s wish. So I start to visit therapist first time in my life.

3

On the first thereapy, in the beginning, she (N) “the first session normally we will just talk about your life story and what you want from the therapy”

In the end, I saw her take notes full of 2 pages of A4 paper, she “this time we just talked about your childhood history, maybe we need another 2 or 3 sessions to finish this process”

I sighed “yes… i know my life story is complicated” …

N asked me “what are you looking for from therapy?” I hope 1. I could be more secure style in the close relationship 2. I could learn better to like/love people in the way they feel more comfortable. 3. I want to clear about what i’m looking for.

As OY said, it’s an self-exploration journey, let’s see.

4

The first three parts are written in June, and it’s December now. haha

I have therapy since May to November for 16 times. At first 9 sessions, every time I’ve cried for around 10 pieces of tissues. It’s not about how I finished with D but what happens between my parents in my teenager time. To be honest, i’m surprised about my reactions. I’ve thought I’ve already gotten over of it and become strong enough, it’s just the past. The fact is I surpress the feelings for many years and I was so broken before.

Lots of time, when therapist asked me “How’s your feeling about that?” I answered “I don’t know, I forgot the feelings, just remember the moment.” So during the therapy, sometimes she will let me stop talking and feel the emotions. “Don’t keep distracting yourself from the feeling.” and she suggested me to search and learn some feelings words XD

In November, I decided to end therapy because I feel confident about my ability to face my emotions and how to behave to build connection with people and will stop dealing with this actively for a while.

5

I recall back how lonely I was before. Although I have lots of friends but I’ve never been close and fully open to them. This year it’s the first time in my life that there is a close friend circle for me. My previous friendship pattern is hanging out once or twice every year and live far away from all of them.

From my diary records, the whole year of 2018, I’ve only have conversations with friends and strangers for 38 times. This year is 172 times until today üòÖ I didn’t count how many times i’ve hang out with my close friends circle in Dublin including Diane, Damon and Hanyang, but almost once a week at least and I remembered I’ve hanged out with Daine 3 times a week before she moved to Paris.

Once in the dinner party at my house, I feel so comfortable and secure because i’m surrounded by friends I’m so familar and trust and know they also feel the same about me. We hang out not because I want some new stories or inspirations from them. It’s the most close feeling that I could imagine the feelings with family expect my brothers üòä.

Back to guys, I met S (another S wit the same name, maybe i have preference about name lmao) in July. When we finished in September, I clearly know it’s not my fault and I do nothing wrong. Actually, with more knowledge about emotions and attachment theory, I feel more understanding about his behaviors, fear and disability.

Then, I met M in an unexpected situation in the end of this year. Without opportunity to build connections more but I still feel grateful for this experience. Glad to know there are guys I feel attracted living and experiencing happily in the world. Life is a journey for my own and it’s nice to meet someone on the road and have a good time together, long or short.

6

In conlcusion, this year I’ve achieved so much improvements about my emotions and relationship security. Being sensitive means I will be easily get hurt. But it also gives more experience and perspectives about world. Have feelings doesn‚Äôt mean I’m weak. I could suppress my negative feelings for short-term, but they will still be there and come back some time.

Right now, I’m clear about what i’m looking for. After 2 yr’s dating experience, I realized I don’t like easily compatibale people, which means they could date with people if she reaches some standards such as appearance, job, some of nomral personality. Different people has different uniqueness. For the same unique point, some people like it, some people feel it’s werid. For me, most of people are similar and some uniqueness are not my taste. Also, I could only fall in love if someone likes me because of my uniqueness and I see him too. I’m looking for the one I see and like the werid uniquesness and don’t care about the definition.

Besides, I accept myself more and open to other people, can’t imagine I could express this kind of thing on the Internet before. More brave to express my needs and prepare to get hurt and loved.

People change and i’m glad I could change. Looking forward to what will happen in the future. : )

        l = input().split()
        
        if l[1] == "-":
            l[1] = None
        else:
            l[1] = int(l[1])
            check[l[1]] =+ 1
        if l[2] == "-":
            l[2] = None
        else:
            l[2] = int(l[2])
            check[l[2]] =+ 1
        # Ê∑ªÂä†ÁªìÁÇπ
        append(Tree, i, l)
        
		# ÊâæÂà∞root
    for i in range(len(check)):
        if check[i] == 0:
            root = i
    # ËøîÂõûÊ†ëÂíåÁªìÁÇπ
    return (Tree, root)
  
# Âà§Êñ≠Ê†ëÁöÑÂêåÊûÑ
def isomorphic(T1, R1, T2, R2):
    # ‰∏§‰∏™Ê†ëÁöÑÁªìÁÇπÊï∞
    n1 = 0
    n2 = 0
    
# Â§ÑÁêÜ‰æãÂ§ñÊÉÖÂÜµ

    # Â¶ÇÊûúÈÉΩ‰∏∫Á©∫Ê†ëÔºå‰∏∫Áúü
    if len(T1) == 0 and len(T2) == 0:
        return True
    
    # Â¶ÇÊûúÂè™Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËäÇÁÇπ
    if (len(T1) == 1 and len(T2) == 1):
      	# ÂÄºÁõ∏ÂêåÔºå‰∏∫Áúü
        if T1[0].data == T2[0].data:
            return True
        # Âê¶Âàô‰∏∫ÂÅá
        else:
            return False
          
    # Â¶ÇÊûúËäÇÁÇπÈÉΩ‰∏∫Èõ∂Ôºå‰∏∫Áúü
    if R1 == None and R2 == None:
        return True
    
    # Â¶ÇÊûúËäÇÁÇπÊï∞‰∏çÂêåÔºå‰∏∫ÂÅá
    if len(T1) != len(T2):
        return False
    
# Â§ÑÁêÜÊ≠£Â∏∏ÊÉÖÂÜµ

    # Â¶ÇÊûú‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏∫Á©∫Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏ç‰∏∫Á©∫Ôºå‰∏∫ÂÅá
    if (R1 == None and R2 != None) or (R1 != None and R2 == None):
        #print('tag2')
        return False

    # Â¶ÇÊûúÂ∑¶ÂÑøÂ≠êÈÉΩ‰∏∫Á©∫ÔºåÂà§Êñ≠Âè≥ÂÑøÂ≠êÊòØÂê¶ÂêåÊûÑ
    if T1[R1].left == None and T2[R2].left == None:
        #print('tag3')
        return isomorphic(T1, T1[R1].right, T2, T2[R2].right)
    
    # Â¶ÇÊûúÂ∑¶ÂÑøÂ≠êÈÉΩ‰∏ç‰∏∫Á©∫‰∏îÊï∞ÊçÆËøòÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÁöÑÔºåÂØπÂ∑¶Âè≥ÂÑøÂ≠êËøõË°åÈÄíÂΩíÂà§Êñ≠
    if (T1[R1].left != None and T2[R2].left != None) and (T1[T1[R1].left].data == T2[T2[R2].left].data):
        return (isomorphic(T1, T1[R1].left, T2, T2[R2].left) and isomorphic(T1, T1[R1].right, T2, T2[R2].right))
    # Â¶ÇÊûúÂ∑¶ÂÑøÂ≠ê‰∏Ä‰∏™Á©∫‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏çÁ©∫ÊàñËÄÖ‰∏§‰∏™ÈÉΩ‰∏çÂêåÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏ç‰∏ÄÊ†∑Ôºå‰∫§Êç¢Â∑¶Âè≥ÂÑøÂ≠êËøõË°åÈÄíÂΩíÂà§Êñ≠
    else:
        return (isomorphic(T1, T1[R1].left, T2, T2[R2].right) and isomorphic(T1, T1[R1].right, T2, T2[R2].left))
      
# main

Tree1,r1 = BuildTree()
Tree2,r2 = BuildTree()

result = isomorphis(Tree1, r1, Tree2, r2)

if result:
    print("Yes")
else:
    print("No")

item.title: About
item.description:
About me

My name is Jarry Wang.

I’m from China, lived in Shanghai during my childhood and lived in Hangzhou (Zhejiang), Foshan (Canton), Chengdu (Sichuan) and Taizhou (Zhejiang) for one or more years.

I’m currently living and studying in Dublin, Ireland, working as software engineer. This is my Github page.

Photography Amateur

Maybe I’m not a qualified photographer, but I’m keen on taking photos. Although I usually take street snapshots, I’m also interested in Portrait, Food and Architecture.

My favorite photographers are Martin Parr, Vivian Maier, Jeff Wall, Marc Riboud, Ueda Shoji, Lv Nan, and Bernard Faucon. This is my Portfolio page. Recently I post my photos on Instagram.

Contact

e-mail: jarrywangcn@outlook.com

About this site

This is where I post articles and thoughts on anything that springs to mind. Mostly on Photography, Books, Travel and people around me.
